properties.areaDesc: Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range/East Lake County Above 11000 Ft; Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; La Garita Mountains Above 10000 Ft
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 2:59PM MST until February 4 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo CO
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches
over the western Mosquito, eastern Sawatch, and La Garita
Mountains, and 6 to 10 inches over the eastern San Juans, with
locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 50
mph.

* WHERE...Western Mosquito Range Above 11000 Feet, Eastern
Sawatch Mountains Above 11000 Feet, La Garita Mountains Above
10000 Feet and Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet.

* WHEN...From 8 AM Monday to 6 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially over Wolf
Creek and Monarch Passes due to snow packed, icy roads. Patchy
areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM MONDAY TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY
